benchmark_details.name: CodeEditorBench
benchmark_details.overview: CodeEditorBench is an evaluation framework designed to rigorously assess the performance of large language models (LLMs) in code editing tasks, including debugging, translating, polishing, and requirement switching.
benchmark_details.data_type: code editing tasks with test cases

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a robust platform for assessing code editing capabilities of LLMs and to catalyze advancements in LLMs for code editing.

data.source: Curated from diverse coding challenges and scenarios, including sources like LeetCode, CodeXGLUE, and CodeNet.
data.size: 7,961 tasks, each with an average of 44 test cases
data.annotation: Manually constructed test cases for each problem and data verified by an Online Judge System.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on whether code generated by LLMs passes all test cases.
methodology.interpretation: A pass rate indicates how many solutions generated by models correctly solved the provided test cases.
methodology.baseline_results: Performance evaluation includes various models such as GPT-4 and OpenCI-DS-33B.
methodology.validation: Cross-validation using multiple samples and performance metrics.
